title: Mac Flip PDF Is Revolutionizing Content Distribution Methods for Mac Users and Publishers
text:
Flip PDF for Mac provides multiple publishing options for content marketing
North Point, Hong Kong -- ( ReleaseWire ) -- 10/13/2015 -- Marketers and online publishers not currently using FlipBuilder are losing out on one of the most revolutionary ways to captivate Mac users to date. Ideal for brochures, magazines, catalogs, annual reports, and so much more, Flip Builder is quickly becoming the definitive choice of flipping book software Mac for any business looking to convert current readerships, and build on the amazing opportunities provided by the platform.
Loaded with media rich features that make on-screen reading an absolute delight, Flip Builder is also astoundingly easy and convenient for Mac-based publishers to create any digital publication they need for their particular audience. The platform is open ended, making it suitable for a vast array of industries and purposes, and the look and feel of the publications it produces will help your readers feel like they are reading an actual print publication due to Flip Builder's turn-page motion and left-to-right-top-down orientation.
Of course, Flip Builder also incorporates the latest in HTML5 and allows publishers to effortlessly build in other media such as video, sounds, music and more, giving readers a completely immersive, revolutionary experience for encountering a brand, story, or product for the first time.
Those interested should learn more about this free eBook maker to learn more about how easy FlipBuilder is to use, and how beautiful its publications can be.
About FlipBuilder
FlipBuilder is the well-known digital publishing developers which provide a series digital publishing solutions to users. Its most useful software is Flip PDF with powerful functions, which is popular among the publishers and marketers.
For more information on this press release visit: http://www.releasewire.com/press-releases/mac-flip-pdf-is-revolutionizing-content-distribution-methods-for-mac-users-and-publishers-632656.htm
 Elina Wu
